alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Eastern Cherry; Thomas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 7:03PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CHERRY...WEST CENTRAL BLAINE AND NORTHERN THOMAS COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM CDT... At 703 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Thedford, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Thedford, Norway, and Natwick. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 200 and 220. Highway 83 between mile markers 144 and 159. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central Nebraska.
